result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Hiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May be candidate for early release if Probation feels that is appropriate.
Concurrent with: Count 5.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid through Probation.
Must provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

May not possess/use firearms or body armor.
Domestic Abuse enhancer which means no firearms for life.
While on Probation must follow up with mental health provider and comply with their recommendations. (Condition of Count 5 also)

May not vote.
May not hold public office.  
Absolute Sobriety - (Condition of Count 5 also)
AODA and comply with recommendations - (Condition of Count 5 also)

timeConds.notes: Conditional Time - STAYED for 30 days to obtain domestic violence assessment and comply.  If assessment is done within the time frame then no conditional time.
25 hours each year - for the first two years of Probation.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
99 days sentence credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid through Probation.
